instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Corner T2 Pulsing
threads.message:
My reference: REF1128

Issue: Thermal camera shows pulsing in the Y1 region of the <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> Chip when initially turned on, but stops after a few seconds. L5800 also I can see warms up during this process. The board does turn on, fan spins, but I get no video on internal or external display. I do get .7v on <SIGNAL>PPVDD_SOC_S1</SIGNAL> so it seems all the other "S" states are present.
I don't get anything for <SIGNAL>VSNS_VSS_PCPU</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Corner T2 Pulsing
threads.message:
Any history available?
Can you put the machine in DFU mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Corner T2 Pulsing
threads.message:
Liquid damage, between UP710 and RV810 the damage is present on one of the traces, looks like one of the slugs between RW080 and RV810. I would not imagine this would affect this? I was not able to get it in to DFU mode but I have not tried to force it. Will try now.
I have also replaced the following: 
UP710
CL031
CL052
CL002
CL053
CL003
CL004
CL012
UF400

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Corner T2 Pulsing
threads.message: No luck with forced DFU mode however it may be trying to do something. I noticed the USB-C meter remains at 5v until I removed the tweezers and it goes back up to 20v. Also I tried hooking an external monitor back up to it again and it seems to be getting a signal, and then it loses the signal, then it repeats this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Corner T2 Pulsing
threads.message:
Something else affected by corrosion.
There may be also accumulated crap underneatch some chips.
